name: butyrolactone production, dehydrogenation of 1,4-butanediol | butyrolactone | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/18634/documentation

This data represents the multioutput-process "butane-1,4-diol dehydrogenation."  This process delivers the co-products butyrolactone and hydrogen.  The raw materials, auxilliaries and energy consumption are modelled with stoichiometric calculations.  The emissions are estimated. Infrastructure is included with a default value.;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:]

From the reception of butane-1,4-diol at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the production of butyrolacetone and hydrogen via the dehydrogenation of 1 kg of butane-1,4-diol.  This dataset includes the input materials, energy uses, infrastructure and emissions.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset is copy of the dataset covering the geography GLO. It is assumed to be representative of the production in RER.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The Reppe process is the most important process to produce butyrolactone. It involves the endothermic dehydrogenation of 1,4-butanediol in the gas phase. This process is used by BASF, ISP, and Lyondell.;Preheated 1,4-butanediol vapor is introduced into a hot stream of circulating hydrogen and passed at atmospheric pressure through a bed of copper catalyst at temperatures between 180 and 240°C. The yield of butyrolactone is approximately 95 %. The reaction takes place via γ-hydroxybutyraldehyde.;The byproduct hydrogen off-gas requires only simple purification before reuse (e.g., catalytic methanization of carbon monoxide impurities). The crude butyrolactone separated from the recycle gas stream contains small amounts of byproducts, including 1,4-butanediol, butyric acid, and high boilers, from which butyrolactone is separated by distillation.

exchanges.description:
Butyrolactone is a colorless, slightly hygroscopic liquid having a faint odor. Butyrolactone is miscible in all proportions with water, alcohols, esters, ethers, ketones, and aromatic hydrocarbons. It has limited miscibility with linear and cyclic aliphatic hydrocarbons. It is an excellent solvent for numerous polymers and a selective solvent for lower hydrocarbons. 

Standard-grade butyrolactone is about 99.7 % pure. The main impurities in the Reppe-based process are 1,4-butanediol, butyric acid, and water; in the maleic ester based processes, dimethyl succinate, 4-hydroxybutyl butyl ether, and water. Electronic-grade butyrolactone is about 99.9 % pure and is subject to stringent restrictions regarding the content of specific ions such as Fe ions, Na+, Cl-, NO3-.

The main use of butyrolactone is as an intermediate in the synthesis of N-methylpyrrolidone (NMP), pyrrolidone, herbicides, growth regulators, and the rubber additive thiodibutyric acid. Butyrolactone is used as a solvent for polymers and as a polymerization catalyst; in hairwave compositions and sun lotions; and in pharmaceuticals. It is also used in printing inks, e.g., for ink-jet printing, as an extractant in the petroleum industry, as a stabilizer for chlorohydrocarbons and phosphorus-based pesticides, and as a nematocide. More recent applications are in the electronics field as a cosolvent for capacitor electrolytes and as a cosolvent for photoresists.

flow.name: butyrolactone
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

exchanges.description:
Calculation.  This data was calculated from the amount of butanediol in the treated waste water assuming a carbon conversion of 96% for COD.  The worst case scenario BOD=COD was used.  
It is assumed that the manufacturing plants are located in an urban/industrial area and consequently the emissions are categorised as emanating in a high population density area.
Water emissions are assumed to be emitted into rivers.

Estimation.  Air emissions occurring from the purge vent, the distillation vent and fugitive emission sources were estimated to 0.2% of the raw material input. 

It is assumed that the manufacturing plants are located in an urban/industrial area and consequently the emissions are categorised as emanating in a high population density area.

exchanges.description: Calculation based on assumptions.  What has not left the process is transformed in CO2 by the waste water treatment.
Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.

Estimation.  Data from a chemical plant site in Germany production 2.05 Mt a-1 (intermediates included) of different chemicals.  
3.2 MJ per kg produced.  62% assumed to come from natural gas.

exchanges.description:
Calculation: what has not left the process through fugitive emissions is assumed to leave through waste water.  90% is assumed to be removed by the treatment.  

It is assumed that the manufacturing plants are located in an urban/industrial area and consequently the emissions are categorised as emanating in a high population density area. 

The emissions into water are assumed to be emitted into rivers.

Calculation.  This data was calculated from the amount of butanediol in the treated waste water assuming a carbon conversion of 96% for COD.  The worst case scenario TOC=DOC was used.  
It is assumed that the manufacturing plants are located in an urban/industrial area and consequently the emissions are categorised as emanating in a high population density area.
Water emissions are assumed to be emitted into rivers.
Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.
Estimation.  Data from a chemical plant site in Germany production 2.05 Mt a-1 (intermediates included) of different chemicals.  24 kg per kg of product.

Calculation.  Calculated from the amount butanediol in the treated waste water assuming a carbon conversion of 96% for COD. The worst case scenario BOD=COD was used.  
It is assumed that the manufacturing plants are located in an urban/industrial area and consequently the emissions are categorised as emanating in a high population density area.
Water emissions are assumed to be emitted into rivers.

Estimation.  Data from a chemical plant site in Germany production 2.05 Mt a-1 (intermediates included) of different chemicals.  
3.2 MJ per kg produced.  62% assumed to come from natural gas, rest from electricity
